transcript:
may as well go back," said the son in French. 
"My dear!" exclaimed his mother implor- ingly, again laying her hand on his arm as if that touch might soothe or rouse him. 
Boris said no more, but looked inquiringly at his mother without taking off his cloak. 
"My friend," said Anna Mikhlylovna in gentle tones, addressing the hall porter, "I know Count Cyril Vladimirovich is very ill . . . that's why I have come ... I am a relation. I shall not disturb him, my friend ... I only need see Prin
